bibl.title: Letter from the Assistant Adjutant General to the Commanding Officer of Fort Myer, November 24, 1902

div1.p: The Secretary of War details the arrangements for Reed's funeral procession.

div1.head: Letter from the Assistant Adjutant General to the Commanding Officer of Fort Myer, November 24, 1902
div1.opener:
[unclear]
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S
GOVERNMENT RATE
TELEGRAM.
OFFICIAL BUSINESS.
----------
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
WASHINGTON
November 24, 1902.
Commanding Officer,
Fort Myer, Virginia.
div1.p:
Secretary War directs that you furnish as escort for
funeral late Major Walter Reed, Medical Department, band and at
least three troops of Cavalry, four if Captain McBlain's funeral
does not interfere. Escort to be at Virginia end Aqueduct Bridge
about three p.m. Tuesday twenty fifth instant. Acknowledge.
div1.closer:
[unclear]
Assistant Adjutant General.
✓ Sent NOV 24 1902
✓ Copy C. O. Army. ✓
✓ " Surg. Gl. ✓
✓ " Deprt O War. ✓
Sent NOV 24 1902
SecWar directs that you furnish anas escort for
funeral of Sur Major Walter Reed, Med. Dept.,
band and at least three troops of Cavalry, four
if Capt. McBlain's funeral does not interfere
Escort to be at Virginia end Aqueduct Bridge about
3 p.m. Tuesday, 25 inst. Acknowledge.
C.O. Ft. Myer. Va.
